content: TaskAgent uses internal engine-based E2E automation via E2E_AUTOMATION_STEPS environment variable rather than external keystroke simulation

To manage project memories: 1) Activate project with mcp_serena_activate_project 2) List memories with mcp_serena_list_memories 3) Read with mcp_serena_read_memory 4) Write/update with mcp_serena_write_memory 5) Delete with mcp_serena_delete_memory
User strongly prefers finding root causes over superficial fixes ('garbage code'), requiring thorough investigation of underlying issues
Serena MCP memories are separate from chat memories: Serena memories are tool-managed named memories, chat memories are JSONL files in memory/chats/
E2E automation steps support: wait (delay), press (key simulation), switchTab (tab navigation), submit (with waitForStream for stream completion), exit (terminate app)
E2E automation uses useRef to persist handleSubmit, isStreaming, and selectedTab to prevent effect interruption from state updates
Updated Serena MCP with two new memories: e2e_testing_approach and development_philosophy
TaskAgent project uses Yarn Berry with Plug'n'Play (no node_modules), TypeScript with strict mode, and React 19 + Ink 6 for terminal UI
